rules.summary: The T allele at rs1801133 (C677T) is associated with reduced MTHFR enzyme activity and, in some studies, higher homocysteine and lower folate status.
CC at rs1801133 is the typical genotype and is not associated with the reduced MTHFR activity seen with the T allele.
The C allele at rs1801131 (A1298C) has been associated with modestly reduced MTHFR activity in some studies.
AA at rs1801131 is the typical genotype and is not associated with the modest activity reduction reported for the C allele.

default_summary: No call or unrecognized genotype for MTHFR markers.
suggestion: If you are concerned about folate status, discuss diet or testing with a clinician. This is not medical advice.

evidence_level.summary: Associations exist but effects are modest and interpretations are controversial.

limitations: MTHFR variants do not diagnose folate deficiency or health conditions. Diet, medications, and other genes matter.
